heading.title: Rules of the Faithful Discord Servers
heading.description:
**Not knowing these is not an excuse for misbehaving, and you can and will be held accountable for your actions. Punishments are up to the discretion of the moderators, and harassing them is only going to make your punishment worse.**

*Use `e!modping` or directly ping an online moderator if rules are being broken. Please do not mini-mod!*

expanded_rules.title: Were you warned or muted unfairly?
expanded_rules.description: A much more in-depth version of our rules, punishment appeal information, and our thought process into giving punishments can be found here: https://docs.faithfulpack.net/pages/moderation/expanded-server-rules

changes.title: Last Update: 23 October 2022
changes.description: Full rewrite and added punishment guidelines/appeals.

rules.title: Read & Follow Discord‚Äôs Terms of Service and Community Guidelines
rules.description: You can find them at https://discord.com/terms and https://discord.com/guidelines respectively. This includes misuse of client modifications (e.g. message loggers) and discussion or promotion of illegal activity.

rules.title: Use Common Sense
rules.description: This is the generic ‚Äúdon‚Äôt be an idiot‚Äù rule. Other prohibited actions include raiding or brigading other servers, using hate speech or slurs, jokes about tragedies or other sensitive topics, and spreading misinformation.

rules.title: Speak English
rules.description: People and by extension moderators can't know what you're saying otherwise, as this is an English-speaking server. Please use a [translator](https://www.deepl.com/translator) if you cannot fluently understand English.

rules.title: Be Constructive and Polite
rules.description: Give constructive criticism people can use to improve their work, not just say that something is ugly or bad. Swearing is allowed within reason, however don‚Äôt cross the line into harassment.

rules.title: Try to Not Annoy Others
rules.description: This includes overly (reply) pinging, sending loud audio or seizure-inducing videos without a spoiler/disclaimer, and abusing nicknames, reactions, or spoilers. Don‚Äôt [ask to ask](https://dontasktoask.com), (e.g. I have a question), just ask your question directly to save everybody time.

rules.title: Don‚Äôt Clutter Chats
rules.description: While short tangents are fine, we have multiple chats for a reason, so please use them as intended. Spamming random things, including emojis and stickers, or starting a chat chain contributes nothing to a conversation and causes a mess.

rules.title: Avoid NSFW and NSFL Content
rules.description: This includes, but is not limited to pornography, gore, overly gross content, etc. If you think it‚Äôs against the rules it probably will be. DM a moderator for approval if you‚Äôre very unsure.

rules.title: Stay Civil around Controversial Topics
rules.description: While topics surrounding politics, religion, firearms, etc, aren‚Äôt entirely prohibited, don't start arguments for the sake of it. When having productive discussions, ensure that it doesn't become a fight and that a moderator is available.

rules.title: No Unsolicited Promoting or Advertising
rules.description: Any sort of advertising that is not in context or clearly solicited is disallowed. Spamming or DM messaging advertisements will get you reported to Discord and banned from the servers.

rules.title: Don‚Äôt Leak Private Information
rules.description: What happens in private channels stays in those channels; keep any confidential information you may have private. Doxxing will get you reported to Discord and banned from the servers.

faq.question: What is Faithful? How did it come to be?
faq.answer:
Faithful is a project spanning several Minecraft resource packs bearing the same name. The aim of Faithful is to provide a higher-resolution experience while still maintaining the look and feel of the vanilla textures. 
Faithful was originally started by Vattic in 2010, and since then he has given the current Faithful Administration the authority to maintain and update the pack officially.

faq.question: What were the Compliance and Emulated Vattic projects?
faq.answer:
The Faithful project was initially called Compliance, prior to when we had received approval from Vattic to continue Faithful under his brand. In addition, Classic Faithful was an entirely separate project called Emulated Vattic Textures (EM for short), but merged with the Faithful Project and adopted the Classic Faithful name during the Faithful rebrand. 
Essentially, Faithful and Compliance are one and the same, and Classic Faithful and Emulated Vattic are one and the same.

faq.question: Who is Kraineff, who is Vattic, and why are there two Faithfuls?
faq.answer:
After Vattic created the original Faithful 32x32 in 2010, he eventually was forced to abandon the project in 2016 due to uncontrollable and unfortunate circumstances in his life. A few months after, an artist named Kraineff (also known as xMrVizzy) claimed that Vattic passed control of the pack to him, and continued Faithful, seemingly officially. 
While Kraineff made increasingly questionable decisions and people started questioning his legitimacy, after a breaking point in November 2020 all of his contributors left him behind to start their own project, called Compliance. Around a month later, these contributors gained contact with Vattic, confirming their suspicions that Vattic never authorized Kraineff to continue Faithful, essentially meaning that Kraineff had been profiting off a stolen name for over 4 years and had been lying about ownership the whole time. If you're interested in this part of the story, you should watch [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kgZYBTlwaVs) for more information. 
However, afterwards when it was clear that Kraineff was never going to willingly relinquish the Faithful name to the now-official Compliance project, the Compliance project rebranded to Faithful in April 2022, causing there to be two Faithfuls.

faq.question: Where can I download Faithful?
faq.answer:
You can always find the latest release of Faithful by clicking these links: 
[Faithful 32x](https://faithfulpack.net/faithful32x/latest) ‚Ä¢ [Faithful 64x](https://faithfulpack.net/faithful64x/latest) 
Downloads for each Classic Faithful pack are listed in regular pages rather than periodic updates, each of which you can find here: 
[Classic Faithful 32x Jappa](https://faithfulpack.net/classicfaithful/32x-jappa) ‚Ä¢ [Classic Faithful 32x Programmer Art](https://faithfulpack.net/classicfaithful/32x-programmer-art) ‚Ä¢ [Classic Faithful 64x](https://faithfulpack.net/classicfaithful/64x-jappa)

faq.question: How do I install Faithful/any resource pack?
faq.answer: We recommend giving [this Minecraft Wiki page](https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Tutorials/Loading_a_resource_pack) a read. Add-ons and tweaks work in exactly the same way, except by applying them on top of the given base pack rather than alone.

faq.question: Is Faithful available for [Minecraft version/edition]?
faq.answer:
Each pack is different: 
- Faithful 32x currently supports Bedrock Edition, and Java versions 1.6 ‚Äì 1.19, 1.4 and Beta 1.7. 
- Classic Faithful 32x Jappa and PA are also available for 1.6 ‚Äì 1.19 and Bedrock Edition, but are currently not complete for b1.7 ‚Äì 1.5. 
- Both 64x packs only currently support the latest Minecraft Java and Bedrock version.

faq.question: Why am I seeing missing/16x/vanilla textures while using Faithful?
faq.answer: You're most likely using an incomplete pack. Currently, the only 100% finished packs are both Faithful 32x and Classic Faithful 32x (Jappa and PA) for Java Edition. You can see each pack's completion at the top of the channel list of their respective servers. If you want to help to get rid of these missing textures, you can help Faithful out by making a texture!

faq.question: Will Faithful ever be available on the Bedrock Edition Marketplace?
faq.answer: Unfortunately, getting resource packs onto the marketplace is a lengthy and complicated process, and a free pack hasn't been published to the marketplace yet. As well as this, community packs are disallowed from the marketplace, as there would be no fair way to compensate everyone involved otherwise monetarily. We would like to eventually release Faithful on the marketplace if possible, but if releasing a free resource pack on the marketplace is not possible, we will not release Faithful there.

faq.question: What Faithful listings are official?
faq.answer:
Each pack has listings on our [website](https://faithfulpack.net), [CurseForge](https://www.curseforge.com/members/faithful_resource_pack/projects), and [Planet Minecraft](https://www.planetminecraft.com/member/faithful_resource_pack/), and some are on [Modrinth](https://modrinth.com/user/Faithful-Resource-Pack) and [MCPEDL](https://mcpedl.com/user/faithful-resource-pack/) too. You can also find our other media and each download link organized by pack in <#774391640306745374>. 
**Downloads from any other sites are unofficial, unsupported and could be dangerous!** Remember to stay safe on the internet.

faq.question: What's the difference between Faithful and Classic Faithful?
faq.answer: The difference is in the art style, not in the textures that are being upscaled. Faithful has a more modern, detailed approach to redrawing textures, while Classic Faithful attempts to follow Vattic's art style from the original Faithful 32x32 as closely as possible, opting for a more brushed, smooth appearance.

faq.question: What are Jappa and Programmer Art textures?
faq.answer:
*JAPPA* is the online nickname of Jasper Boerstra, Minecraft's lead artist and the author of the majority of textures used in versions 1.14 and newer. The "new" Minecraft textures are often called Jappa textures in his honour. 
Programmer Art (oftentimes abbreviated as "progart" or "PA") is the name given by Mojang and used by the Minecraft artist community for the old textures, used in Minecraft prior to release 1.14. It's also the name of the built-in resource pack featured in newer versions that contains the old textures.

faq.question: What is the difference between 16x, 32x, and 64x?
faq.answer:
"32x" means the textures, as a base, are 32 by 32 pixels (rather than default's 16 by 16 pixels). "64x" means the textures are 64 by 64 pixels. Higher numbers mean higher resolution textures. While these values are technically arbitrary, anything other than powers of two can cause issues in-game. 
*The pixel resolution of the textures aren't related to whether they are "Jappa" or "Programmer Art".*

faq.question: But I don't like the new Minecraft textures! Faithful Programmer Art when?
faq.answer: For now, Faithful 32x/64x is only based on Minecraft's new textures, or Jappa textures as we call them. There are plans for a dedicated Faithful Programmer Art pack, but for the time being check out [Classic Faithful 32x Programmer Art](https://faithfulpack.net/classicfaithful/32x-programmer-art).

faq.question: I've found a bug in Faithful! Where do I report it?
faq.answer:
Please post any bug reports and/or opinions about the pack in <#774246985448030209> or report them as an issue on the appropriate GitHub repository. 
[Faithful GitHub](https://github.com/Faithful-Resource-Pack) ‚Ä¢ [Classic Faithful GitHub](https://github.com/ClassicFaithful)

faq.question: How can I submit a texture to the pack? How does the approval process work?
faq.answer:
For the main Faithful packs, please read [The Faithful Contributor's Handbook](https://docs.faithfulpack.net/pages/textures/contributor-handbook). 
TL;DR: You will need to accept the agreement in <#991031483089186826> first. To submit textures, upload them one at a time to the appropriate submission channel. Any text you include with the message will be added as a comment, and people pinged in the comment will be added as co-authors. 
To be accepted into the pack, your texture must pass a round of community voting (lasting 2 days) and a round of private Art Director Council voting (lasting one day). 
For Classic Faithful, the submission process is exactly the same but only takes one day of community voting and no council vote instead.

faq.question: How can I submit my Add-on to the website?
faq.answer: On https://webapp.faithfulpack.net/, log in with your Discord account. Next, in the navigation bar at the top, click Add-ons and select Upload. Finally, fill out the form that you're presented with, and when you're finished, click the Submit button. Your Add-on will appear on the website when it has been reviewed and approved by an Manager.

faq.question: Does Faithful support mods?
faq.answer:
Yes, you can find mod support for the 32x version of the pack at https://www.faithfulpack.net/mods or https://www.faithfulpack.net/modpacks. Please note, however, that the textures may be outdated and that development is not very active at the moment, and that 64x is not supported at all right now. 
If you want to contribute to Faithful Mods, please reach out in <#1025645837247848458> for more information.

faq.question: CompliBot is offline! What do I do?
faq.answer: If the bot ever goes offline without previous notice from the developers, please ping __one__ of the online bot devs (<@473860522710794250>, <@207471947662098432>, or <@173336582265241601>) and alert them of the issue.

faq.question: I have found a bug in CompliBot or Wynem and I want to request a fix and/or give feedback, how do I do it?
faq.answer: If you find any bugs with CompliBot and/or have any requests, you can use the `/feedback` command to send feedback directly to the bot developers. For Wynem, you can use `e!suggest`. You can also report any CompliBot related problems directly by making an issue on the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Faithful-Resource-Pack/Discord-Bot).

faq.question: I need help from a moderator!
faq.answer: You can use Wynem's `e!modping` command to call an online Moderator to help. We kindly ask not to misuse the command.

faq.question: What's the difference between an Add-on and a Tweak?
faq.answer:
We define the differences in the following way: 
**Tweak**: A Tweak changes existing aspects about the game. They are one-off and smaller than an Add-on ‚Äì changes of multiple themes should not be grouped into one Tweak. Examples: 3D items, Consistent Bedrock. 
**Add-on**: An Add-on adds new features to the game, and/or is usually larger in scope than a Tweak. Examples: New random variations for blocks/mobs. 
Additionally, due to technical limitations, PBR resource packs cannot reuse textures from the main Faithful pack, and therefore can function as standalone ‚Äì but for the sake of simplicity, they are also considered Add-ons. 
Lastly, collections of Tweaks that the author chooses not to submit individually are considered Add-ons as well.

faq.question: How can I submit my Tweak?
faq.answer: For the time being, Tweaks can be submitted as Add-ons, using the method mentioned above. A Vanilla Tweaks-styled customiser is planned for the future, but its development is currently on pause due to us having no developer for it.

faq.question: How do I submit a texture for a mod?
faq.answer: For the time being, contact a Manager to receive further instructions. There are plans in the future to make this process easier to do.

faq.question: Will Faithful affect my FPS?
faq.answer: The short answer is no. While ludicrously high-resolution packs may cause a minor decrease (well above the scope of the Faithful project), in general shaders are the major graphics-related culprit for causing large amounts of lag, not resource packs. When a resource pack claims to boost FPS, there's a good chance it's completely lying or it will cause a very marginal increase at best.

faq.question: A texture I made passed voting, how do I get the Contributor role?
faq.answer: While automating this process is planned in the future, for the time being simply ping an online Manager. The same process goes for getting the Add-on Maker role.

faq.question: How can I use Faithful textures in my own projects?
faq.answer: First, read [our license](https://faithfulpack.net/license) to see that your project meets our terms (no monetization, giving clear credit, etc). If it meets all the terms and conditions, no further permission is required.

description.autopush: Use this command to push textures from #results to GitHub.
description.channelpush: Use this command to send textures to council and result channels!
description.ban: Ban a user from the current Discord server
description.push: Push file to GitHub & update the contributor list.
description.hotfix: Fix something, may change at anytime
description.infoembed: Posts specific embeds for the info channel categories on the Compliance servers.
description.restart: Pulls modifications and restart the bot
description.say: Make the bot send any message you specify
description.status:
Changes the bot's status: 
**Activity**:
PLAYING, STREAMING, LISTENING, WATCHING, COMPETING, CUSTOM_STATUS (does not work)
**Presence**:
online, idle, dnd
description.bean: get B E A N E D
description.slowmode: Enable or disable the slowmode in a channel
description.about: Displays a texture that you or someone else made
description.color: Use this command to show information about a color.
description.compare: Allows vanilla / pack comparaison side by side
description.feeback: Suggest things or report bugs directly to the bot devs.
description.guidelines: Shows the texturing guidelines of Compliance 32x.
description.help: Show help for a specified command.
description.info: Displays some info about the bot in your DMs.
description.magnify:
Resize an image,
Image URL needs to end with ``.png``, ``.jpeg/jpg`` or ``.gif``,
Message ID needs to be from the same channel.
Magnify only the first frame of a GIF
description.missing: Shows tree view of missing textures for a particular edition
description.modping: Tag online mods to call for help.
description.modtools: Displays tools for Minecraft Dungeons modding.
description.palette:
Get the colours of an image,
Image URL needs to end with ``.png``, ``.jpeg/jpg`` or ``.gif``,
Message ID needs to be from the same channel.
GIF: Return the palette of the first frame only
description.poll: Make a poll to ask people!
description.profile: Add personal information for the Compliance Website Gallery.
description.skin: Get the skin of a Minecraft Player.
description.stats: Displays various stats of the bot in your DMs.
description.texture:
Displays a specified texture from either vanilla Minecraft or Compliance.
You can search for a texture name, or use ``_`` at the beginning to search for non-complete names (such as _sword).
You can also use ``/`` at the begining to specify a folder instead of a texture name.
description.tile:
Tile an image, if no arguments are given, a grid shape is selected by default. The bot searches the last 10 messages for an image.
GIF: only works with the first frame.
description.translate: Translates messages to the selected language.
description.website: Displays website for the given keyword, see examples for keywords.
description.feedback: Suggest things or report bugs directly to the bot devs.
description.faq: Use this command to get frequently asked questions using "tags", you can see "tags" inside the #faq channel
description.charshift: Encodes with Caesar shift with given offset.
description.love: Shows the love for someone else.
description.kick: Kick a user from the current Discord server
